    d𝑑ditalic_d: Total sequence length or dimension of 𝒙𝒙{\bm{x}}bold_italic_x.

  • •

    l𝑙litalic_l: Generating sequence length.

  • •

    π𝜋\piitalic_π: one permutation, π⁢(l)𝜋𝑙\pi(l)italic_π ( italic_l ) denotes the l𝑙litalic_l-th element of permutation π𝜋\piitalic_π, π(<l)annotated𝜋absent𝑙\pi(<l)italic_π ( < italic_l ) denotes the elements of permutation π𝜋\piitalic_π with indices less than l𝑙litalic_l.

  • •

    U⁢(⋅)𝑈⋅U(\cdot)italic_U ( ⋅ ): Uniform distribution.

  • •

    pλ(⋅|𝒙0)p_{\lambda}(\cdot|{\bm{x}}_{0})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ): The joint distribution induced by masking each dimension in 𝒙0subscript𝒙0{\bm{x}}_{0}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT independently with a probability λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ.

  • •

    Cat: Categorical distribution.

  • •

    NFEs: Number of function evaluations.

  • •

    E-NFEs: Expected number of function evaluations.

Appendix B Proof of Theorem 1

In this section, we provide a detailed proof of Theorem 1, which is carried out in three key steps. The core idea of the proof involves leveraging the properties of a continuous-time Markov chain with an absorbing state, where the forward diffusion process is independent across different dimensions. This independence simplifies the analysis of both the conditional and joint distributions.

First, we derive the analytic form of the conditional distribution, as stated in Lemma 1. This can be derived directly from Eq. 2.3, but for a better understanding, we provide a more intuitive proof for 𝑸t=σ⁢(t)⁢𝑸absorbsubscript𝑸𝑡𝜎𝑡superscript𝑸absorb{\bm{Q}}_{t}=\sigma(t){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_σ ( italic_t ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Second, we extend this analysis to multiple dimensions to obtain the joint distribution, as formalized in Proposition 1. Finally, by simply dividing the joint distributions derived in the second step, we decouple the concrete score, thereby completing the proof of Theorem 1.

Lemma 1.

(Analytic conditional distribution in absorbing diffusion) Suppose {Xt}subscript𝑋𝑡\{X_{t}\}{ italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } is a continuous time Markov chain with transition rate matrix 𝐐t=σ⁢(t)⁢𝐐absorbsubscript𝐐𝑡𝜎𝑡superscript𝐐absorb{\bm{Q}}_{t}=\sigma(t){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_σ ( italic_t ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, given the value x0subscript𝑥0x_{0}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at time zero , the conditional distribution pt|0⁢(xt|x0)subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥0p_{t|0}(x_{t}|x_{0})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) has the following analytic form:

pt|0⁢(xt|x0)={e−σ¯⁢(t),xt=x0,1−e−σ¯⁢(t),xt=[M],0,xt≠[M]⁢and⁢xt≠x0.subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥0casessuperscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥01superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡delimited-[]M0subscript𝑥𝑡delimited-[]Mandsubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥0p_{t|0}(x_{t}|x_{0})=\begin{cases}e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)},&x_{t}=x_{0},\\ 1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)},&x_{t}=[\textbf{M}],\\ 0,&x_{t}\neq[\textbf{M}]\ \text{and}\ x_{t}\neq x_{0}.\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ M ] , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ [ M ] and italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (B.1)
Proof.

Given the initial value x0∈𝒳={1,⋯,N}subscript𝑥0𝒳1⋯𝑁x_{0}\in\mathcal{X}=\{1,\cdots,N\}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_X = { 1 , ⋯ , italic_N }, we have

xt={x0,t<Th,[M],t≥Th.subscript𝑥𝑡casessubscript𝑥0𝑡subscript𝑇ℎdelimited-[]M𝑡subscript𝑇ℎx_{t}=\begin{cases}x_{0},&t<T_{h},\\ [\textbf{M}],&t\geq T_{h}.\end{cases}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_t < italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL [ M ] , end_CELL start_CELL italic_t ≥ italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (B.2)

Here, Thsubscript𝑇ℎT_{h}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT represents the holding time before x0subscript𝑥0x_{0}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT transitions to the absorbing state [M].

Based on the definition of the 𝑸tsubscript𝑸𝑡{\bm{Q}}_{t}bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in Eq. 2.2 and 𝑸absorbsuperscript𝑸absorb{\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, the probability of x0subscript𝑥0x_{0}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT remaining the same after a small time increment Δ⁢tΔ𝑡\Delta troman_Δ italic_t is

pt+Δ⁢t|t⁢(x0|x0)=1+σ⁢(t)⁢𝑸absorb⁢(x0,x0)⁢Δ⁢t+o⁢(Δ⁢t).subscript𝑝𝑡conditionalΔ𝑡𝑡conditionalsubscript𝑥0subscript𝑥01𝜎𝑡superscript𝑸absorbsubscript𝑥0subscript𝑥0Δ𝑡𝑜Δ𝑡p_{t+\Delta t|t}(x_{0}|x_{0})=1+\sigma(t){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}(x_{0},x_{0})% \Delta t+o(\Delta t).italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t + roman_Δ italic_t | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = 1 + italic_σ ( italic_t ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_Δ italic_t + italic_o ( roman_Δ italic_t ) . (B.3)

Partitioning the interval [0,t]0𝑡[0,t][ 0 , italic_t ] into {sk}k=0nsuperscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑠𝑘𝑘0𝑛\{s_{k}\}_{k=0}^{n}{ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and utilizing the memoryless property of continuous-time Markov chains, we can express the probability of x0subscript𝑥0x_{0}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT remaining the same from time 0 to t𝑡titalic_t as a product of probabilities over these small intervals. This gives us:

pt|0⁢(x0|x0)subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝑥0subscript𝑥0\displaystyle p_{t|0}(x_{0}|x_{0})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =∏k=1npsk|sk−1⁢(x0|x0)absentsuperscriptsubscriptproduct𝑘1𝑛subscript𝑝conditionalsubscript𝑠𝑘subscript𝑠𝑘1conditionalsubscript𝑥0subscript𝑥0\displaystyle=\prod_{k=1}^{n}p_{s_{k}|s_{k-1}}(x_{0}|x_{0})= ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (B.4)
=∏k=1n(1+σ⁢(tk−1)⁢𝑸absorb⁢(x0,x0)⁢(sk−sk−1)+o⁢(sk−sk−1))absentsuperscriptsubscriptproduct𝑘1𝑛1𝜎subscript𝑡𝑘1superscript𝑸absorbsubscript𝑥0subscript𝑥0subscript𝑠𝑘subscript𝑠𝑘1𝑜subscript𝑠𝑘subscript𝑠𝑘1\displaystyle=\prod_{k=1}^{n}\left(1+\sigma(t_{k-1}){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}(x% _{0},x_{0})(s_{k}-s_{k-1})+o(s_{k}-s_{k-1})\right)= ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + italic_σ ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_o ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) (B.5)
=exp⁡(∑k=1nln⁡(1+σ⁢(tk−1)⁢𝑸absorb⁢(x0,x0)⁢(sk−sk−1)+o⁢(sk−sk−1)))absentsuperscriptsubscript𝑘1𝑛1𝜎subscript𝑡𝑘1superscript𝑸absorbsubscript𝑥0subscript𝑥0subscript𝑠𝑘subscript𝑠𝑘1𝑜subscript𝑠𝑘subscript𝑠𝑘1\displaystyle=\exp\left(\sum_{k=1}^{n}\ln\left(1+\sigma(t_{k-1}){\bm{Q}}^{% \text{absorb}}(x_{0},x_{0})(s_{k}-s_{k-1})+o\left(s_{k}-s_{k-1}\right)\right)\right)= roman_exp ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ln ( 1 + italic_σ ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_o ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ) (B.6)
=exp⁡(∑k=1nσ⁢(tk−1)⁢𝑸absorb⁢(x0,x0)⁢(sk−sk−1)+o⁢(sk−sk−1)).absentsuperscriptsubscript𝑘1𝑛𝜎subscript𝑡𝑘1superscript𝑸absorbsubscript𝑥0subscript𝑥0subscript𝑠𝑘subscript𝑠𝑘1𝑜subscript𝑠𝑘subscript𝑠𝑘1\displaystyle=\exp\left(\sum_{k=1}^{n}\sigma(t_{k-1}){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}(% x_{0},x_{0})(s_{k}-s_{k-1})+o(s_{k}-s_{k-1})\right).= roman_exp ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_o ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) . (B.7)

Let max⁡(sk−sk−1)→0→subscript𝑠𝑘subscript𝑠𝑘10\max(s_{k}-s_{k-1})\to 0roman_max ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) → 0 , the Riemann sum in Eq. B.7 equals the following continuous integral:

pt|0⁢(x0|x0)=exp⁡(∫0tσ⁢(s)⁢𝑸absorb⁢(x0,x0)⁢𝑑s)=exp⁡(𝑸absorb⁢(x0,x0)⁢σ¯⁢(t)).subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝑥0subscript𝑥0superscriptsubscript0𝑡𝜎𝑠superscript𝑸absorbsubscript𝑥0subscript𝑥0differential-d𝑠superscript𝑸absorbsubscript𝑥0subscript𝑥0¯𝜎𝑡p_{t|0}(x_{0}|x_{0})=\exp\left(\int_{0}^{t}\sigma(s){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}(x% _{0},x_{0})ds\right)=\exp\left({\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}(x_{0},x_{0})\bar{% \sigma}(t)\right).italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_exp ( ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_s ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d italic_s ) = roman_exp ( bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) ) . (B.8)

By Eq. 2.9, 𝑸absorb⁢(x0,x0)=−1superscript𝑸absorbsubscript𝑥0subscript𝑥01{\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}(x_{0},x_{0})=-1bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = - 1, we have

pt|0⁢(x0|x0)=P⁢(Th>t)=e−σ¯⁢(t)subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝑥0subscript𝑥0𝑃subscript𝑇ℎ𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡\displaystyle p_{t|0}(x_{0}|x_{0})=P(T_{h}>t)=e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_P ( italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_t ) = italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (B.9)
pt|0⁢([M]|x0)=P⁢(Th≤t)=1−e−σ¯⁢(t)subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionaldelimited-[]Msubscript𝑥0𝑃subscript𝑇ℎ𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡\displaystyle p_{t|0}([\textbf{M}]|x_{0})=P(T_{h}\leq t)=1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( [ M ] | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_P ( italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_t ) = 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (B.10)
pt|0⁢(k|x0)=0if⁢k≠[M]⁢and⁢k≠x0.formulae-sequencesubscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditional𝑘subscript𝑥00if𝑘delimited-[]Mand𝑘subscript𝑥0\displaystyle p_{t|0}(k|x_{0})=0\quad\text{if}\ k\neq[\textbf{M}]\ \text{and}% \ k\neq x_{0}.italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_k | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = 0 if italic_k ≠ [ M ] and italic_k ≠ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (B.11)

Similarly, given value xssubscript𝑥𝑠x_{s}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at time s<t𝑠𝑡s<titalic_s < italic_t, the conditional distribution can be expressed as

pt|s⁢(xt|xs)={e−(σ¯⁢(t)−σ¯⁢(s)),xt=xs,1−e−(σ¯⁢(t)−σ¯⁢(s)),xt=[M],0,xt≠[M]⁢and⁢xt≠xs.subscript𝑝conditional𝑡𝑠conditionalsubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠casessuperscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡¯𝜎𝑠subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡¯𝜎𝑠subscript𝑥𝑡delimited-[]M0subscript𝑥𝑡delimited-[]Mandsubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠p_{t|s}(x_{t}|x_{s})=\begin{cases}e^{-\left(\bar{\sigma}(t)-\bar{\sigma}(s)% \right)},&x_{t}=x_{s},\\ 1-e^{-\left(\bar{\sigma}(t)-\bar{\sigma}(s)\right)},&x_{t}=[\textbf{M}],\\ 0,&x_{t}\neq[\textbf{M}]\ \text{and}\ x_{t}\neq x_{s}.\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ M ] , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ [ M ] and italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (B.12)

∎

Proposition 1.

(Analytic joint distribution in absorbing diffusion)

Suppose {Xt}subscript𝑋𝑡\{X_{t}\}{ italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } is a continuous time Markov chain with transition rate matrix 𝐐t=σ⁢(t)⁢𝐐absorbsubscript𝐐𝑡𝜎𝑡superscript𝐐absorb{\bm{Q}}_{t}=\sigma(t){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_σ ( italic_t ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. For 𝐱t=xt1⁢⋯⁢xtdsubscript𝐱𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡1⋯superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑑{\bm{x}}_{t}=x_{t}^{1}\cdots x_{t}^{d}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with d1subscript𝑑1d_{1}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT components as [M]delimited-[]M[\textbf{M}][ M ] and d2=d−d1subscript𝑑2𝑑subscript𝑑1d_{2}=d-d_{1}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_d - italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT components as unmasked tokens, pt⁢(𝐱t)subscript𝑝𝑡subscript𝐱𝑡p_{t}({\bm{x}}_{t})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) can be expressed as

pt⁢(𝒙t)=[1−e−σ¯⁢(t)]d1⁢[e−σ¯⁢(t)]d2⁢p0⁢(𝒙tUM),subscript𝑝𝑡subscript𝒙𝑡superscriptdelimited-[]1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑑1superscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑑2subscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UMp_{t}({\bm{x}}_{t})=[1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}]^{d_{1}}[e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}]^{d_% {2}}p_{0}({\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}}),italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = [ 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , (B.13)

where 𝐱tUMsuperscriptsubscript𝐱𝑡UM{\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the vector consists of all unmasked tokens of 𝐱tsubscript𝐱𝑡{\bm{x}}_{t}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Proposition 1 shows that the joint distribution pt⁢(𝒙t)subscript𝑝𝑡subscript𝒙𝑡p_{t}({\bm{x}}_{t})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) can be expressed as the multiplication of two terms. One is an analytic term only depending on time, the other is a d2subscript𝑑2d_{2}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT dimensions joint distribution of clean data p0⁢(𝒙tUM)subscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UMp_{0}({\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) independent of time.

Proof.

Without loss of generality, let’s assume that the preceding d1subscript𝑑1d_{1}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT terms of 𝒙𝒙{\bm{x}}bold_italic_x are all [M], and the remaining d2subscript𝑑2d_{2}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT terms are unmasked tokens. That is, 𝒙t=[M]⁢⋯⁢[M]⁢xtd1+1⁢⋯⁢xtdsubscript𝒙𝑡delimited-[]M⋯delimited-[]Msuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑑11⋯superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑑{\bm{x}}_{t}=[\textbf{M}]\cdots[\textbf{M}]x_{t}^{d_{1}+1}\cdots x_{t}^{d}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ M ] ⋯ [ M ] italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and here xksuperscript𝑥𝑘x^{k}italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is an unmasked token in 𝒳𝒳\mathcal{X}caligraphic_X.

Using the law of total probability and Lemma 1, along with the assumption of independence between different dimensions of the diffusion process, we can express the joint distribution pt⁢([M]⁢⋯⁢[M]⁢xtd1+1⁢⋯⁢xtd)subscript𝑝𝑡delimited-[]M⋯delimited-[]Msuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑑11⋯superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑑p_{t}([\textbf{M}]\cdots[\textbf{M}]x_{t}^{d_{1}+1}\cdots x_{t}^{d})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( [ M ] ⋯ [ M ] italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) as a sum over all possible initial states 𝒙0∈𝒳dsubscript𝒙0superscript𝒳𝑑{\bm{x}}_{0}\in\mathcal{X}^{d}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT:

=\displaystyle== [1−e−σ¯⁢(t)]d1⁢[e−σ¯⁢(t)]d2⁢p0⁢(xtd1+1⁢⋯⁢xtd).superscriptdelimited-[]1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑑1superscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑑2subscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑑11⋯superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑑\displaystyle[1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}]^{d_{1}}[e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}]^{d_{2}}p_{% 0}(x_{t}^{d_{1}+1}\cdots x_{t}^{d}).[ 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

By noting that p0⁢(xtd1+1⁢⋯⁢xtd)=p0⁢(𝒙tUM)subscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑑11⋯superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑑subscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UMp_{0}(x_{t}^{d_{1}+1}\cdots x_{t}^{d})=p_{0}({\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), in the general case, we have

pt⁢(𝒙t)=[1−e−σ¯⁢(t)]d1⁢[e−σ¯⁢(t)]d2⁢p0⁢(𝒙tUM),subscript𝑝𝑡subscript𝒙𝑡superscriptdelimited-[]1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑑1superscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑑2subscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UMp_{t}({\bm{x}}_{t})=[1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}]^{d_{1}}[e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}]^{d_% {2}}p_{0}({\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}}),italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = [ 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ,

which demonstrates that the likelihood of the noisy data 𝒙tsubscript𝒙𝑡{\bm{x}}_{t}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at time t𝑡titalic_t equals the likelihood of the unmasked part 𝒙tUMsuperscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UM{\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT at time 00 multiplied by an analytic time-dependent term. ∎

Proof.

According to Proposition 1, if xti=[M]superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]Mx_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] and x^ti≠[M]superscriptsubscript^𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]M\hat{x}_{t}^{i}\neq[\textbf{M}]over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≠ [ M ], 𝒙^tUM=(𝒙tUM,x^ti)superscriptsubscript^𝒙𝑡UMsuperscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UMsuperscriptsubscript^𝑥𝑡𝑖\hat{{\bm{x}}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}}=({\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}},\hat{x}_{t}^{i})over^ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ),

∎

Appendix C Proof of Theorem 2

See 2

Here, the infinity final total noise level guarantees that all tokens will be finally masked with probability one (1−e−σ¯⁢(T)1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑇1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(T)}1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT). Below we present the detailed proof in three steps.

C.1 Equivalence between DSE loss and t-DCE loss

For a given noisy input 𝒙tsubscript𝒙𝑡{\bm{x}}_{t}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, as established in Section 3.1, 𝒙^tsubscript^𝒙𝑡{\hat{{\bm{x}}}_{t}}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is valid only when it contains exactly one more unmasked token than 𝒙tsubscript𝒙𝑡{\bm{x}}_{t}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. In this case, the transition probability 𝑸t⁢(𝒙^t,𝒙t)subscript𝑸𝑡subscript^𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙𝑡{\bm{Q}}_{t}\left({\hat{{\bm{x}}}_{t}},{\bm{x}}_{t}\right)bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) equals σ⁢(t)𝜎𝑡\sigma(t)italic_σ ( italic_t ). Replace 𝒔θ⁢(𝒙t)subscript𝒔𝜃subscript𝒙𝑡{\bm{s}}_{\theta}({\bm{x}}_{t})bold_italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) with e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢𝒄θ⁢(𝒙t)superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝒄𝜃subscript𝒙𝑡\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}({\bm{x}}_% {t})divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG bold_italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), we can express the DSE loss in the multi-dimensional case as follows:

ℒDSET⁢(𝒙0)superscriptsubscriptℒDSE𝑇subscript𝒙0\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\textrm{DSE}}^{T}({\bm{x}}_{0})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DSE end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =∫0T𝔼𝒙t∼pt|0⁢(𝒙t|𝒙0)[∑xti=[M],j≠[M]σ(t)(e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)𝒄θ(𝒙t)[i,j]\displaystyle=\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}],j\neq[\textbf{M}]}\sigma(t)% \left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}({% \bm{x}}_{t})[i,j]\right.\right.= ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] , italic_j ≠ [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_t ) ( divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG bold_italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) [ italic_i , italic_j ]

+∫0T𝔼𝒙t∼pt|0⁢(𝒙t|𝒙0)⁢[∑xti=[M],j≠[M]−σ⁢(t)⁢e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢𝕀⁢(x0i=j)⁢log⁡(e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢𝒄θ⁢(𝒙t)⁢[i,j])]⁢𝑑tsuperscriptsubscript0𝑇subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptformulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]M𝑗delimited-[]M𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡𝕀superscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖𝑗superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝒄𝜃subscript𝒙𝑡𝑖𝑗differential-d𝑡\displaystyle+\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}],j\neq[\textbf{M}]}-\frac{% \sigma(t)e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\mathbb{I}(x_{0}^{i}=j)% \log\left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}% ({\bm{x}}_{t})[i,j]\right)\right]dt+ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] , italic_j ≠ [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG italic_σ ( italic_t ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_I ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_j ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - +∫0T𝔼𝒙t∼pt|0⁢(𝒙t|𝒙0)⁢[∑xti=[M],j≠[M]σ⁢(t)⁢K⁢(e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢I⁢(x0i=j))]⁢𝑑t.superscriptsubscript0𝑇subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptformulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]M𝑗delimited-[]M𝜎𝑡𝐾superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡𝐼superscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖𝑗differential-d𝑡\displaystyle+\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}],j\neq[\textbf{M}]}\sigma(t)K% \left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}I(x_{0}^{i}=j)\right)% \right]dt.+ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] , italic_j ≠ [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_t ) italic_K ( divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG italic_I ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_j ) ) ] italic_d italic_t .

We analyze each term in the above equation separately. The first term simplifies due to the property ∑j≠[M]𝒄θ⁢(𝒙t)⁢[i,j]=1subscript𝑗delimited-[]Msubscript𝒄𝜃subscript𝒙𝑡𝑖𝑗1\sum_{j\neq[\textbf{M}]}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}({\bm{x}}_{t})[i,j]=1∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j ≠ [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) [ italic_i , italic_j ] = 1:

∫0T𝔼𝒙t∼pt|0⁢(𝒙t|𝒙0)⁢[∑xti=[M]σ⁢(t)⁢e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)]⁢𝑑t.superscriptsubscript0𝑇subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]M𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡differential-d𝑡\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{\bm{x}}_{0})}% \left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}\sigma(t)\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-% \bar{\sigma}(t)}}\right]dt.∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_t ) divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ] italic_d italic_t . (C.1)

The third term can be simplified by substituting K⁢(a)=a⁢log⁡a−a𝐾𝑎𝑎𝑎𝑎K(a)=a\log a-aitalic_K ( italic_a ) = italic_a roman_log italic_a - italic_a and using 0⁢log⁡0=00000\log 0=00 roman_log 0 = 0:

∫0T𝔼𝒙t∼pt|0⁢(𝒙t|𝒙0)⁢[∑xti=[M]σ⁢(t)⁢e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢(log⁡e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)−1)]⁢𝑑t.superscriptsubscript0𝑇subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]M𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1differential-d𝑡\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{\bm{x}}_{0})}% \left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}\sigma(t)\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-% \bar{\sigma}(t)}}\left(\log\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}% -1\right)\right]dt.∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_t ) divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( roman_log divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG - 1 ) ] italic_d italic_t . (C.2)

Combining the first and third terms:

∫0T𝔼𝒙t∼pt|0⁢(𝒙t|𝒙0)⁢[∑xti=[M]σ⁢(t)⁢e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢(log⁡e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t))]⁢𝑑tsuperscriptsubscript0𝑇subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]M𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡differential-d𝑡\displaystyle\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}\sigma(t)\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma% }(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\left(\log\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar% {\sigma}(t)}}\right)\right]dt∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_t ) divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( roman_log divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) ] italic_d italic_t (C.3)
=\displaystyle== ∫0Td⁢(1−e−σ¯⁢(t))⁢σ⁢(t)⁢e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢(log⁡e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t))⁢𝑑tsuperscriptsubscript0𝑇𝑑1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡differential-d𝑡\displaystyle\int_{0}^{T}d(1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)})\sigma(t)\frac{e^{-\bar{% \sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\left(\log\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^% {-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\right)dt∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d ( 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_σ ( italic_t ) divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( roman_log divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) italic_d italic_t (C.4)
=\displaystyle== d⁢∫0Tσ⁢(t)⁢e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢log⁡e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢d⁢t.𝑑superscriptsubscript0𝑇𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡𝑑𝑡\displaystyle d\int_{0}^{T}\sigma(t)e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}\log\frac{e^{-\bar{% \sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}dt.italic_d ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_t ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG italic_d italic_t . (C.5)

Introducing a new variable λ⁢(t)=1−e−σ¯⁢(t)𝜆𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡\lambda(t)=1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}italic_λ ( italic_t ) = 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which represents the probability of a token being masked from 00 to t𝑡titalic_t in the forward process. As σ¯⁢(t)=∫0tσ⁢(τ)⁢𝑑τ¯𝜎𝑡superscriptsubscript0𝑡𝜎𝜏differential-d𝜏\bar{\sigma}(t)=\int_{0}^{t}\sigma(\tau)d\tauover¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) = ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_τ ) italic_d italic_τ and σ¯⁢(T)=∞¯𝜎𝑇\bar{\sigma}(T)=\inftyover¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_T ) = ∞, we have λ⁢(0)=0𝜆00\lambda(0)=0italic_λ ( 0 ) = 0, λ⁢(T)=1𝜆𝑇1\lambda(T)=1italic_λ ( italic_T ) = 1 and d⁢λ=σ⁢(t)⁢e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢d⁢t𝑑𝜆𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡𝑑𝑡d\lambda=\sigma(t)e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}dtitalic_d italic_λ = italic_σ ( italic_t ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d italic_t. Obviously, λ⁢(t)𝜆𝑡\lambda(t)italic_λ ( italic_t ) is invertible, which allows us to perform a change of variables from t𝑡titalic_t to λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ and simplifies Eq. C.5 to

d⁢∫01log⁡1−λλ⁢d⁢λ=−d⁢(λ⁢log⁡λ+(1−λ)⁢log⁡(1−λ))|01=0.𝑑superscriptsubscript011𝜆𝜆𝑑𝜆evaluated-at𝑑𝜆𝜆1𝜆1𝜆010\displaystyle d\int_{0}^{1}\log\frac{1-\lambda}{\lambda}d\lambda=-d\left(% \lambda\log\lambda+(1-\lambda)\log(1-\lambda)\right)|_{0}^{1}=0.italic_d ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG 1 - italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG italic_d italic_λ = - italic_d ( italic_λ roman_log italic_λ + ( 1 - italic_λ ) roman_log ( 1 - italic_λ ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 0 . (C.6)

Here we used

limλ→0λ⁢log⁡λ=limλ→1(1−λ)⁢log⁡(1−λ)=0.subscript→𝜆0𝜆𝜆subscript→𝜆11𝜆1𝜆0\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\lambda\log\lambda=\lim_{\lambda\to 1}(1-\lambda)\log(1-% \lambda)=0.roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ → 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ roman_log italic_λ = roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ → 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_λ ) roman_log ( 1 - italic_λ ) = 0 .

Thus, the DSE loss reduces to the second term, which we define as the t𝑡titalic_t-denoising cross-entropy loss (t⁢-DCE𝑡-DCEt\textrm{-DCE}italic_t -DCE):

ℒt⁢-DCET⁢(𝒙0)superscriptsubscriptℒ𝑡-DCE𝑇subscript𝒙0\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{t\textrm{-DCE}}^{T}({\bm{x}}_{0})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t -DCE end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =∫0T𝔼𝒙t∼pt|0⁢(𝒙t|𝒙0)⁢[∑xti=[M],j≠[M]−σ⁢(t)⁢e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢𝕀⁢(x0i=j)⁢log⁡(e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢𝒄θ⁢(𝒙t)⁢[i,j])]⁢𝑑tabsentsuperscriptsubscript0𝑇subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptformulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]M𝑗delimited-[]M𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡𝕀superscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖𝑗superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝒄𝜃subscript𝒙𝑡𝑖𝑗differential-d𝑡\displaystyle=\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}],j\neq[\textbf{M}]}-\frac{% \sigma(t)e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\mathbb{I}(x_{0}^{i}=j)% \log\left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}% ({\bm{x}}_{t})[i,j]\right)\right]dt= ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] , italic_j ≠ [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG italic_σ ( italic_t ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_I ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_j ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - =∫0T𝔼𝒙t∼pt|0⁢(𝒙t|𝒙0)⁢[∑xti=[M]−σ⁢(t)⁢e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢log⁡(e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢𝒄θ⁢(𝒙t)⁢[i,x0i])]⁢𝑑tabsentsuperscriptsubscript0𝑇subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]M𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝒄𝜃subscript𝒙𝑡𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖differential-d𝑡\displaystyle=\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\frac{\sigma(t)e^{-\bar{% \sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\log\left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^% {-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}({\bm{x}}_{t})[i,x_{0}^{i}]\right)\right]dt= ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG italic_σ ( italic_t ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log ( divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - =∫0T𝔼𝒙t∼pt|0⁢(𝒙t|𝒙0)⁢[∑xti=[M]−σ⁢(t)⁢e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢log⁡(e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢qθ⁢(x0i|𝒙tUM))]⁢𝑑t.absentsuperscriptsubscript0𝑇subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]M𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UMdifferential-d𝑡\displaystyle=\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\frac{\sigma(t)e^{-\bar{% \sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\log\left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^% {-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}})\right)% \right]dt.= ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG italic_σ ( italic_t ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log ( divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT -
