C.2 Equivalence between t-DCE loss and lambda-DCE loss

Starting from the t⁢-DCE𝑡-DCEt\textrm{-DCE}italic_t -DCE loss in Eq. 3.4, we can perform a change of variable from t𝑡titalic_t to λ⁢(t)=1−e−σ¯⁢(t)𝜆𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡\lambda(t)=1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}italic_λ ( italic_t ) = 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, as demonstrated in Section C.1. This allows us to rewrite the t⁢-DCE𝑡-DCEt\textrm{-DCE}italic_t -DCE loss integral in terms of λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ:

∫011λ⁢𝔼𝒙λ∼pλ⁢(𝒙λ|𝒙0)⁢[∑xλi=[M]−log⁡(1−λλ⁢qθ⁢(x0i|𝒙λUM))]⁢𝑑λsuperscriptsubscript011𝜆subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝑝𝜆conditionalsubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝜆𝑖delimited-[]M1𝜆𝜆subscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒙𝜆UMdifferential-d𝜆\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}\sim p% _{\lambda}({\bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{\lambda}^{i}=[% \textbf{M}]}-\log\left(\frac{1-\lambda}{\lambda}q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_% {\lambda}^{\textrm{UM}})\right)\right]d\lambda∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log ( divide start_ARG 1 - italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ] italic_d italic_λ
=\displaystyle== ∫011λ⁢𝔼𝒙λ∼pλ⁢(𝒙λ|𝒙0)⁢[∑xλi=[M]−log⁡qθ⁢(x0i|𝒙λUM)]⁢𝑑λ+∫011λ⁢𝔼𝒙λ∼pλ⁢(𝒙λ|𝒙0)⁢[∑xλi=[M]−log⁡(1−λλ)]⁢𝑑λ.superscriptsubscript011𝜆subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝑝𝜆conditionalsubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝜆𝑖delimited-[]Msubscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒙𝜆UMdifferential-d𝜆superscriptsubscript011𝜆subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝑝𝜆conditionalsubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝜆𝑖delimited-[]M1𝜆𝜆differential-d𝜆\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}\sim p% _{\lambda}({\bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{\lambda}^{i}=[% \textbf{M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}^{\textrm{UM}})\right% ]d\lambda+\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}\sim p_{% \lambda}({\bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{\lambda}^{i}=[\textbf% {M}]}-\log(\frac{1-\lambda}{\lambda})\right]d\lambda.∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] italic_d italic_λ + ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log ( divide start_ARG 1 - italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) ] italic_d italic_λ .

Given the independence of the forward process and Lemma 1, the original probability pt|0⁢(𝒙t|𝒙0)subscript𝑝conditional𝑡0conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙0p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{\bm{x}}_{0})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) can be factorized as ∏i=1dpt|0i⁢(xti|x0i)superscriptsubscriptproduct𝑖1𝑑superscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑡0𝑖conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖\prod_{i=1}^{d}p_{t|0}^{i}(x_{t}^{i}|x_{0}^{i})∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), where

pt|0i⁢(xti|x0i)={1−e−σ¯⁢(t),xti=[M],e−σ¯⁢(t),xti=x0i,0,else.superscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑡0𝑖conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖cases1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]Msuperscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖0elsep_{t|0}^{i}(x_{t}^{i}|x_{0}^{i})=\begin{cases}1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)},&x_{t}^{i% }=[\textbf{M}],\\ e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)},&x_{t}^{i}=x_{0}^{i},\\ 0,&\text{else}.\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL else . end_CELL end_ROW (C.7)

Therefore, the induced probability pλ⁢(𝒙λ|𝒙0)=∏i=1dpλi⁢(xλi|x0i)subscript𝑝𝜆conditionalsubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝒙0superscriptsubscriptproduct𝑖1𝑑superscriptsubscript𝑝𝜆𝑖conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝜆𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖p_{\lambda}({\bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm{x}}_{0})=\prod_{i=1}^{d}p_{\lambda}^{i}(x_% {\lambda}^{i}|x_{0}^{i})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) where

pλi⁢(xλi|x0i)={λ,xλi=[M],1−λ,xλi=x0i,0,else.superscriptsubscript𝑝𝜆𝑖conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝜆𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖cases𝜆superscriptsubscript𝑥𝜆𝑖delimited-[]M1𝜆superscriptsubscript𝑥𝜆𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖0elsep_{\lambda}^{i}(x_{\lambda}^{i}|x_{0}^{i})=\begin{cases}\lambda,&x_{\lambda}^{% i}=[\textbf{M}],\\ 1-\lambda,&x_{\lambda}^{i}=x_{0}^{i},\\ 0,&\text{else}.\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_λ , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 1 - italic_λ , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL else . end_CELL end_ROW (C.8)

Next, consider the second term in the λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ integral. Similar to Eq. C.3, we can prove that it equals zero:

∫011λ⁢𝔼𝒙λ∼pλ⁢(𝒙λ|𝒙0)⁢[∑xλi=[M]−log⁡(1−λλ)]=0.superscriptsubscript011𝜆subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝑝𝜆conditionalsubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝜆𝑖delimited-[]M1𝜆𝜆0\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}\sim p_{\lambda}({% \bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{\lambda}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log% (\frac{1-\lambda}{\lambda})\right]=0.∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log ( divide start_ARG 1 - italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) ] = 0 . (C.9)

Therefore, t⁢-DCE𝑡-DCEt\textrm{-DCE}italic_t -DCE loss is equivalent to the first term, which we defined as λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ-denoising cross-entropy (λ⁢-DCE𝜆-DCE\lambda\textrm{-DCE}italic_λ -DCE):

ℒλ⁢-DCET⁢(𝒙0)=∫011λ⁢𝔼𝒙λ∼pλ⁢(𝒙λ|𝒙0)⁢[∑xλi=[M]−log⁡qθ⁢(x0i|𝒙λUM)]⁢𝑑λ.superscriptsubscriptℒ𝜆-DCE𝑇subscript𝒙0superscriptsubscript011𝜆subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝑝𝜆conditionalsubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝜆𝑖delimited-[]Msubscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒙𝜆UMdifferential-d𝜆\mathcal{L}_{\lambda\textrm{-DCE}}^{T}({\bm{x}}_{0})=\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{% \lambda}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}\sim p_{\lambda}({\bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm% {x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{\lambda}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|% {\bm{x}}_{\lambda}^{\textrm{UM}})\right]d\lambda.caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ -DCE end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] italic_d italic_λ . (C.10)

C.3 Equivalence between lambda-DCE loss and any-order autoregressive loss

Based on λ⁢-DCE𝜆-DCE\lambda\textrm{-DCE}italic_λ -DCE loss in Eq. 3.5, we first define the sample space and analytically express the expectation term.

Given 𝒙0subscript𝒙0{\bm{x}}_{0}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we define the sample space of 𝒙λsubscript𝒙𝜆{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as 𝒳~⁢(𝒙0):={x01,[M]}×⋯⁢{x0d,[M]}assign~𝒳subscript𝒙0superscriptsubscript𝑥01delimited-[]M⋯superscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑑delimited-[]M\tilde{\mathcal{X}}({\bm{x}}_{0}):=\{x_{0}^{1},[\textbf{M}]\}\times\cdots\{x_{% 0}^{d},[\textbf{M}]\}over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) := { italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , [ M ] } × ⋯ { italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , [ M ] } and 𝒳~k⁢(𝒙0):={𝒙~:𝒙~∈𝒳~⁢(𝒙0)∧𝒙~⁢has exact k dimensions with values ⁢[M]}assignsubscript~𝒳𝑘subscript𝒙0conditional-set~𝒙~𝒙~𝒳subscript𝒙0~𝒙has exact k dimensions with values delimited-[]M\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0}):=\{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}:\tilde{{\bm{x}}}\in% \tilde{\mathcal{X}}({\bm{x}}_{0})\land\tilde{{\bm{x}}}\ \text{has exact k % dimensions with values }[\textbf{M}]\}over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) := { over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG : over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG ∈ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∧ over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG has exact k dimensions with values [ M ] } . It follows that |𝒳~⁢(𝒙0)|=2d~𝒳subscript𝒙0superscript2𝑑|\tilde{\mathcal{X}}({\bm{x}}_{0})|=2^{d}| over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | = 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and |𝒳~k⁢(𝒙0)|=(dk)subscript~𝒳𝑘subscript𝒙0binomial𝑑𝑘|\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0})|=\binom{d}{k}| over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | = ( FRACOP start_ARG italic_d end_ARG start_ARG italic_k end_ARG ). Therefore, the sample space 𝒳~⁢(𝒙0)~𝒳subscript𝒙0\tilde{\mathcal{X}}({\bm{x}}_{0})over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) can be decoupled by the number of masked tokens k𝑘kitalic_k in 𝒙~~𝒙\tilde{{\bm{x}}}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG:

∫011λ⁢𝔼𝒙λ∼pλ⁢(𝒙λ|𝒙0)⁢[∑x~i=[M]−log⁡qθ⁢(x0i|𝒙λUM)]⁢𝑑λsuperscriptsubscript011𝜆subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝑝𝜆conditionalsubscript𝒙𝜆subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~𝑥𝑖delimited-[]Msubscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒙𝜆UMdifferential-d𝜆\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}\sim p% _{\lambda}({\bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{\tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf% {M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}^{\textrm{UM}})\right]d\lambda∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] italic_d italic_λ (C.11)
=\displaystyle== ∫011λ⁢∑x~∈𝒳~⁢(𝒙0)pλ⁢(𝒙~|𝒙0)⁢[∑x~i=[M]−log⁡qθ⁢(x0i|𝒙~UM)]⁢d⁢λsuperscriptsubscript011𝜆subscript~𝑥~𝒳subscript𝒙0subscript𝑝𝜆conditional~𝒙subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~𝑥𝑖delimited-[]Msubscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖superscript~𝒙UM𝑑𝜆\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\sum_{\tilde{x}\in\tilde{\mathcal{X}% }({\bm{x}}_{0})}p_{\lambda}(\tilde{{\bm{x}}}|{\bm{x}}_{0})\left[\sum_{\tilde{x% }^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{\textrm{UM}})% \right]d\lambda∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ∈ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] italic_d italic_λ (C.12)
=\displaystyle== ∫011λ⁢∑k=0d∑𝒙~∈𝒳~k⁢(𝒙0)λk⁢(1−λ)d−k⁢[∑x~i=[M]−log⁡qθ⁢(x0i|𝒙~UM)]⁢d⁢λsuperscriptsubscript011𝜆superscriptsubscript𝑘0𝑑subscript~𝒙subscript~𝒳𝑘subscript𝒙0superscript𝜆𝑘superscript1𝜆𝑑𝑘delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~𝑥𝑖delimited-[]Msubscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖superscript~𝒙UM𝑑𝜆\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\sum_{k=0}^{d}\sum_{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}% \in\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0})}\lambda^{k}(1-\lambda)^{d-k}\left[% \sum_{\tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{% \textrm{UM}})\right]d\lambda∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG ∈ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_λ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d - italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] italic_d italic_λ (C.13)
=\displaystyle== ∫011λ⁢∑k=1d∑𝒙~∈𝒳~k⁢(𝒙0)λk⁢(1−λ)d−k⁢[∑x~i=[M]−log⁡qθ⁢(x0i|𝒙~UM)]⁢d⁢λ.superscriptsubscript011𝜆superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝑑subscript~𝒙subscript~𝒳𝑘subscript𝒙0superscript𝜆𝑘superscript1𝜆𝑑𝑘delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~𝑥𝑖delimited-[]Msubscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖superscript~𝒙UM𝑑𝜆\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\sum_{k=1}^{d}\sum_{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}% \in\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0})}\lambda^{k}(1-\lambda)^{d-k}\left[% \sum_{\tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{% \textrm{UM}})\right]d\lambda.∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG ∈ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_λ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d - italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] italic_d italic_λ . (C.14)

The last equation holds because there are no masked tokens when k=0𝑘0k=0italic_k = 0, and the inner sum is zero.

From Eq. C.14, by rearranging the order of summation and integration, we can analytically evaluate the integral ∫01λk−1⁢(1−λ)d−k⁢𝑑λsuperscriptsubscript01superscript𝜆𝑘1superscript1𝜆𝑑𝑘differential-d𝜆\int_{0}^{1}\lambda^{k-1}(1-\lambda)^{d-k}d\lambda∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_λ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d - italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d italic_λ using the Beta function, which eliminates λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ:

Eq. C.14=Eq. C.14absent\displaystyle\lx@cref{creftype~refnum}{eq:lambda_k_mix}== ∑k=1d∫01λk−1⁢(1−λ)d−k⁢𝑑λ⁢∑𝒙~∈𝒳~k⁢(𝒙0)[∑x~i=[M]−log⁡qθ⁢(x0i|𝒙~UM)]superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝑑superscriptsubscript01superscript𝜆𝑘1superscript1𝜆𝑑𝑘differential-d𝜆subscript~𝒙subscript~𝒳𝑘subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~𝑥𝑖delimited-[]Msubscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖superscript~𝒙UM\displaystyle\sum_{k=1}^{d}\int_{0}^{1}\lambda^{k-1}(1-\lambda)^{d-k}d\lambda% \sum_{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}\in\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{% \tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{% \textrm{UM}})\right]∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_λ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d - italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d italic_λ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG ∈ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] (C.15)
=\displaystyle== ∑k=1d(k−1)!⁢(d−k)!d!⁢∑𝒙~∈𝒳~k⁢(𝒙0)[∑x~i=[M]−log⁡qθ⁢(x0i|𝒙~UM)]superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝑑𝑘1𝑑𝑘𝑑subscript~𝒙subscript~𝒳𝑘subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~𝑥𝑖delimited-[]Msubscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖superscript~𝒙UM\displaystyle\sum_{k=1}^{d}\frac{(k-1)!(d-k)!}{d!}\sum_{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}\in% \tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{\tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-% \log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{\textrm{UM}})\right]∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG ( italic_k - 1 ) ! ( italic_d - italic_k ) ! end_ARG start_ARG italic_d ! end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG ∈ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] (C.16)
=\displaystyle== ∑k=1d1k⁢Cdk⁢∑𝒙~∈𝒳~k⁢(𝒙0)[∑x~i=[M]−log⁡qθ⁢(x0i|𝒙~UM)].superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝑑1𝑘superscriptsubscript𝐶𝑑𝑘subscript~𝒙subscript~𝒳𝑘subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~𝑥𝑖delimited-[]Msubscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖superscript~𝒙UM\displaystyle\sum_{k=1}^{d}\frac{1}{kC_{d}^{k}}\sum_{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}\in\tilde% {\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{\tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log q% _{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{\textrm{UM}})\right].∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_k italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG ∈ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] . (C.17)

Eq. C.17 can be reformulated in terms of an expectation over a uniform distribution U⁢(𝒳~k⁢(𝒙0))𝑈subscript~𝒳𝑘subscript𝒙0U(\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0}))italic_U ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) as follows:

∑k=1d1k⁢𝔼𝒙~∼U⁢(𝒳~k⁢(𝒙0))⁢[∑x~i=[M](−log⁡(qθ⁢(x0i|𝒙~UM)))].superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝑑1𝑘subscript𝔼similar-to~𝒙𝑈subscript~𝒳𝑘subscript𝒙0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~𝑥𝑖delimited-[]Msubscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝑖superscript~𝒙UM\displaystyle\sum_{k=1}^{d}\frac{1}{k}\mathbb{E}_{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}\sim U(% \tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0}))}\left[\sum_{\tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}% \left(-\log(q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{\textrm{UM}}))\right)\right].∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_k end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG ∼ italic_U ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( - roman_log ( italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ) ] . (C.18)

Let π𝜋\piitalic_π be one permutation of the integers 1,⋯,d1⋯𝑑1,\cdots,d1 , ⋯ , italic_d, and Uπsubscript𝑈𝜋U_{\pi}italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT represent the uniform distribution of all orders. We note that Eq. C.18 is equivalent to the following term from the perspective of any-order autoregressive model:

∑k=1d1k⁢𝔼π∼Uπ⁢∑r=d−k+1d−log⁡qθ⁢(x0π⁢(r)|x0π(<d−k+1);π).superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝑑1𝑘subscript𝔼similar-to𝜋subscript𝑈𝜋superscriptsubscript𝑟𝑑𝑘1𝑑subscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝜋𝑟superscriptsubscript𝑥0annotated𝜋absent𝑑𝑘1𝜋\displaystyle\sum_{k=1}^{d}\frac{1}{k}\mathbb{E}_{\pi\sim U_{\pi}}\sum_{r=d-k+% 1}^{d}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{\pi(r)}|x_{0}^{\pi(<d-k+1)};\pi).∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_k end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∼ italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r = italic_d - italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_r ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π ( < italic_d - italic_k + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_π ) . (C.19)

Here, x0π(<l)superscriptsubscript𝑥0annotated𝜋absent𝑙x_{0}^{\pi(<l)}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π ( < italic_l ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT denotes the sequence of the first l−1𝑙1l-1italic_l - 1 elements in the permutation π𝜋\piitalic_π. Given a fixed k𝑘kitalic_k, the term x0π(<d−k+1)superscriptsubscript𝑥0annotated𝜋absent𝑑𝑘1x_{0}^{\pi(<d-k+1)}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π ( < italic_d - italic_k + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT can be interpreted as the unmasked part of the noisy data 𝒙~UMsuperscript~𝒙UM\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{\textrm{UM}}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. For r=d−k+1,⋯,d𝑟𝑑𝑘1⋯𝑑r=d-k+1,\cdots,ditalic_r = italic_d - italic_k + 1 , ⋯ , italic_d, x0π⁢(r)superscriptsubscript𝑥0𝜋𝑟x_{0}^{\pi(r)}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_r ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT corresponds to the k𝑘kitalic_k items of the masked part. Since both π𝜋\piitalic_π and 𝒙~~𝒙\tilde{{\bm{x}}}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG are both uniformly sampled, Eq. C.18 and Eq. C.19 are equivalent.

Further, we can make a simple subscription transformation by letting l=d−k+1𝑙𝑑𝑘1l=d-k+1italic_l = italic_d - italic_k + 1 and change the summation to Monte Carlo estimation on Eq. C.19 :

d⋅𝔼l∼U⁢(1,⋯,d)⁢1d−l+1⁢𝔼π∼Uπ⁢∑r=ld−log⁡qθ⁢(x0π⁢(r)|x0π(<l);π).⋅𝑑subscript𝔼similar-to𝑙𝑈1⋯𝑑1𝑑𝑙1subscript𝔼similar-to𝜋subscript𝑈𝜋superscriptsubscript𝑟𝑙𝑑subscript𝑞𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥0𝜋𝑟superscriptsubscript𝑥0annotated𝜋absent𝑙𝜋\displaystyle d\cdot\mathbb{E}_{l\sim U(1,\cdots,d)}\frac{1}{d-l+1}\mathbb{E}_% {\pi\sim U_{\pi}}\sum_{r=l}^{d}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{\pi(r)}|x_{0}^{\pi(<l)}% ;\pi).italic_d ⋅ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l ∼ italic_U ( 1 , ⋯ , italic_d ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_d - italic_l + 1 end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∼ italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r = italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_r ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π ( < italic_l ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_π ) . (C.20)

In [30, 31], it was proved that Eq. C.20 is mathematically equivalent to Eq. 2.16. Actually, Eq. C.20 is widely used as a training objective for any-order autoregressive models for efficient parallel optimization.

This concludes our proof of Theorem 2.

Appendix D Sampling methods

In this section, we first derived the exact reverse distribution for absorbing discrete diffusion in Section D.1. This derivation led to simplified forms of the Tweedie τ𝜏\tauitalic_τ-leaping and Euler methods, detailed in Section D.2 and Section D.3, respectively. In Section D.4, we proved the equivalence of these two methods under a log-linear noise schedule. Finally, in Section D.5, we discussed the expected number of function evaluations (E-NFEs) for these methods.

D.1 Exact reverse distribution in absorbing discrete diffusion

Lemma 2.

(Analytic reverse distribution in absorbing diffusion) Suppose {Xt}subscript𝑋𝑡\{X_{t}\}{ italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } is a continuous time Markov chain with transition rate matrix 𝐐t=σ⁢(t)⁢𝐐absorbsubscript𝐐𝑡𝜎𝑡superscript𝐐absorb{\bm{Q}}_{t}=\sigma(t){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_σ ( italic_t ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. For 𝐱t=xt1⁢⋯⁢xtdsubscript𝐱𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡1⋯superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑑{\bm{x}}_{t}=x_{t}^{1}\cdots x_{t}^{d}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with d1subscript𝑑1d_{1}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT masked tokens and d2=d−d1subscript𝑑2𝑑subscript𝑑1d_{2}=d-d_{1}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_d - italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT unmasked tokens, and 𝐱s=xs1⁢⋯⁢xsdsubscript𝐱𝑠superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠1⋯superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑑{\bm{x}}_{s}=x_{s}^{1}\cdots x_{s}^{d}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with d1−Δ⁢dsubscript𝑑1Δ𝑑d_{1}-\Delta ditalic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_Δ italic_d masked tokens and d2+Δ⁢dsubscript𝑑2Δ𝑑d_{2}+\Delta ditalic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Δ italic_d unmasked tokens, the reverse distribution is given by:

ps|t⁢(𝒙s|𝒙t)={[e−σ¯⁢(s)−e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(s)]Δ⁢d⁢[1−e−σ¯⁢(s)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)]d1⁢p0⁢(𝒙sUM)p0⁢(𝒙tUM),𝒙t⊆UM𝒙s,0,𝒙t⊈UM𝒙s,subscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑠subscript𝒙𝑡casessuperscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠Δ𝑑superscriptdelimited-[]1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑑1subscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑠UMsubscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UMsubscriptUMsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙𝑠0subscriptnot-subset-of-or-equalsUMsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙𝑠p_{s|t}({\bm{x}}_{s}|{\bm{x}}_{t})=\begin{cases}\left[\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s% )}-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}}\right]^{\Delta d}\left[\frac{% 1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\right]^{d_{1}}\frac{p_{0}({\bm% {x}}_{s}^{\textrm{UM}})}{p_{0}({\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}})},&{\bm{x}}_{t}% \subseteq_{\text{UM}}{\bm{x}}_{s},\\ 0,&{\bm{x}}_{t}\not\subseteq_{\text{UM}}{\bm{x}}_{s},\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL [ divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Δ italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ divide start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG , end_CELL start_CELL bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊈ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW (D.1)

where 𝐱t⊆UM𝐱ssubscriptUMsubscript𝐱𝑡subscript𝐱𝑠{\bm{x}}_{t}\subseteq_{\text{UM}}{\bm{x}}_{s}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT denotes ∀i::for-all𝑖absent\forall i:∀ italic_i : 𝐱ti≠[M]superscriptsubscript𝐱𝑡𝑖delimited-[]M{\bm{x}}_{t}^{i}\neq[\textbf{M}]bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≠ [ M ], we have 𝐱ti=𝐱sisuperscriptsubscript𝐱𝑡𝑖superscriptsubscript𝐱𝑠𝑖{\bm{x}}_{t}^{i}={\bm{x}}_{s}^{i}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Proof.

Using Bayes’ theorem, ps|t⁢(𝒙s|𝒙t)=pt|s⁢(𝒙t|𝒙s)⁢ps⁢(𝒙s)pt⁢(𝒙t)subscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑠subscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑝conditional𝑡𝑠conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙𝑠subscript𝑝𝑠subscript𝒙𝑠subscript𝑝𝑡subscript𝒙𝑡p_{s|t}({\bm{x}}_{s}|{\bm{x}}_{t})=p_{t|s}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{\bm{x}}_{s})\frac{p_{% s}({\bm{x}}_{s})}{p_{t}({\bm{x}}_{t})}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG.

From Proposition 1:

pt⁢(𝒙t)subscript𝑝𝑡subscript𝒙𝑡\displaystyle p_{t}({\bm{x}}_{t})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =[1−e−σ¯⁢(t)]d1⁢[e−σ¯⁢(t)]d2⁢p0⁢(𝒙tUM),absentsuperscriptdelimited-[]1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑑1superscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑑2subscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UM\displaystyle=[1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}]^{d_{1}}[e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}]^{d_{2}}p_% {0}({\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}}),= [ 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , (D.2)
ps⁢(𝒙s)subscript𝑝𝑠subscript𝒙𝑠\displaystyle p_{s}({\bm{x}}_{s})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =[1−e−σ¯⁢(s)]d1−Δ⁢d⁢[e−σ¯⁢(s)]d2+Δ⁢d⁢p0⁢(𝒙sUM).absentsuperscriptdelimited-[]1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠subscript𝑑1Δ𝑑superscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠subscript𝑑2Δ𝑑subscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑠UM\displaystyle=[1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}]^{d_{1}-\Delta d}[e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}]^% {d_{2}+\Delta d}p_{0}({\bm{x}}_{s}^{\textrm{UM}}).= [ 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_Δ italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Δ italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) . (D.3)

Utilizing Eq. B.12, we get

pt|s⁢(𝒙t|𝒙s)=∏i=1dpt|si⁢(xti|xsi)={[e−(σ¯⁢(t)−σ¯⁢(s))]d2⁢[1−e−(σ¯⁢(t)−σ¯⁢(s))]Δ⁢d,𝒙t⊆UM𝒙s,0,𝒙t⊈UM𝒙s.subscript𝑝conditional𝑡𝑠conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙𝑠superscriptsubscriptproduct𝑖1𝑑superscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑡𝑠𝑖conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑖casessuperscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡¯𝜎𝑠subscript𝑑2superscriptdelimited-[]1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡¯𝜎𝑠Δ𝑑subscriptUMsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙𝑠0subscriptnot-subset-of-or-equalsUMsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙𝑠p_{t|s}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{\bm{x}}_{s})=\prod_{i=1}^{d}p_{t|s}^{i}(x_{t}^{i}|x_{s}^% {i})=\begin{cases}\left[e^{-\left(\bar{\sigma}(t)-\bar{\sigma}(s)\right)}% \right]^{d_{2}}\left[1-e^{-\left(\bar{\sigma}(t)-\bar{\sigma}(s)\right)}\right% ]^{\Delta d},&{\bm{x}}_{t}\subseteq_{\text{UM}}{\bm{x}}_{s},\\ 0,&{\bm{x}}_{t}\not\subseteq_{\text{UM}}{\bm{x}}_{s}.\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Δ italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊈ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (D.4)

Simplifying these equations, we can express ps|t⁢(𝒙s|𝒙t)subscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑠subscript𝒙𝑡p_{s|t}({\bm{x}}_{s}|{\bm{x}}_{t})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) as

ps|t⁢(𝒙s|𝒙t)={[e−σ¯⁢(s)−e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(s)]Δ⁢d⁢[1−e−σ¯⁢(s)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)]d1⁢p0⁢(𝒙sUM)p0⁢(𝒙tUM),𝒙t⊆UM𝒙s,0,𝒙t⊈UM𝒙s.subscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑠subscript𝒙𝑡casessuperscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠Δ𝑑superscriptdelimited-[]1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑑1subscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑠UMsubscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UMsubscriptUMsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙𝑠0subscriptnot-subset-of-or-equalsUMsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙𝑠p_{s|t}({\bm{x}}_{s}|{\bm{x}}_{t})=\begin{cases}\left[\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s% )}-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}}\right]^{\Delta d}\left[\frac{% 1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\right]^{d_{1}}\frac{p_{0}({\bm% {x}}_{s}^{\textrm{UM}})}{p_{0}({\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}})},&{\bm{x}}_{t}% \subseteq_{\text{UM}}{\bm{x}}_{s},\\ 0,&{\bm{x}}_{t}\not\subseteq_{\text{UM}}{\bm{x}}_{s}.\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL [ divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Δ italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ divide start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG , end_CELL start_CELL bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊈ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (D.5)

∎

It should be noted that when 𝒙t⊆UM𝒙ssubscriptUMsubscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝒙𝑠{\bm{x}}_{t}\subseteq_{\text{UM}}{\bm{x}}_{s}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the ratio p0⁢(𝒙sUM)p0⁢(𝒙tUM)subscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑠UMsubscript𝑝0superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UM\frac{p_{0}({\bm{x}}_{s}^{\textrm{UM}})}{p_{0}({\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}})}divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG can be reformulated as a d1subscript𝑑1d_{1}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-dimensional conditional distribution p0⁢(𝒙sUM|𝒙tUM)subscript𝑝0conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝒙𝑠UMsuperscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UMp_{0}({\bm{x}}_{s}^{\textrm{UM}}|{\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) with Nd1superscript𝑁subscript𝑑1N^{d_{1}}italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT states. This is not accessible using our one-dimensional conditional distribution p0⁢(x^ti|𝒙tUM)subscript𝑝0conditionalsuperscriptsubscript^𝑥𝑡𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UMp_{0}(\hat{x}_{t}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) in Theorem 1 if d1>1subscript𝑑11d_{1}>1italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 1. Therefore, for efficiency, existing samplers assume that each dimension is independent within a small interval and update each dimension in parallel [29, 26].

D.2 Tweedie τ𝜏\tauitalic_τ-leaping method and its simplified form in RADD

Given the vector 𝒙tsubscript𝒙𝑡{\bm{x}}_{t}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, if we sample each xsisuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑖x_{s}^{i}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT independently, the factorization of marginal distribution ps|ttweediesuperscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡tweediep_{s|t}^{\text{tweedie}}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT tweedie end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT results in the minimum KL divergence with true reverse ps|t⁢(𝒙s|𝒙t)subscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡conditionalsubscript𝒙𝑠subscript𝒙𝑡p_{s|t}({\bm{x}}_{s}|{\bm{x}}_{t})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (proof in  [29], Appendix A). This assumption formally defines ps|ttweediesuperscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡tweediep_{s|t}^{\text{tweedie}}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT tweedie end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT as follows:

ps|ttweedie⁢(𝒙s|𝒙t)=∏i=1dps|ttweedie,i⁢(xsi|𝒙t)=∏i=1dps|ti⁢(xsi|𝒙t).superscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡tweedieconditionalsubscript𝒙𝑠subscript𝒙𝑡superscriptsubscriptproduct𝑖1𝑑superscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡tweedie𝑖conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑖subscript𝒙𝑡superscriptsubscriptproduct𝑖1𝑑superscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡𝑖conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑖subscript𝒙𝑡p_{s|t}^{\text{tweedie}}({\bm{x}}_{s}|{\bm{x}}_{t})=\prod_{i=1}^{d}p_{s|t}^{% \text{tweedie},i}(x_{s}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_{t})=\prod_{i=1}^{d}p_{s|t}^{i}(x_{s}^{i}% |{\bm{x}}_{t}).italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT tweedie end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT tweedie , italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (D.6)

To sample from ps|ttweediesuperscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡tweediep_{s|t}^{\text{tweedie}}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT tweedie end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we need to derive the analytic form of ps|ti⁢(xsi|𝒙t)superscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡𝑖conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑖subscript𝒙𝑡p_{s|t}^{i}(x_{s}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_{t})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Without loss of generality, let’s assume that the preceding d1subscript𝑑1d_{1}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT terms of 𝒙tsubscript𝒙𝑡{\bm{x}}_{t}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are all [M]delimited-[]M[\textbf{M}][ M ], and the remaining d2subscript𝑑2d_{2}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT terms are unmasked tokens.

For illustration, we can take i=1𝑖1i=1italic_i = 1 as an example. Let 𝒳~ksubscript~𝒳𝑘\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT denote the sample space of length d1−1subscript𝑑11d_{1}-1italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 sequence where each sequence has exact k𝑘kitalic_k masked tokens, with |𝒳~k|=Cd1−1k⁢Nd1−1−ksubscript~𝒳𝑘superscriptsubscript𝐶subscript𝑑11𝑘superscript𝑁subscript𝑑11𝑘|\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}|=C_{d_{1}-1}^{k}N^{d_{1}-1-k}| over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | = italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 - italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. =e−σ¯⁢(s)−e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢p0⁢(xs1|𝒙td1+1:d).absentsuperscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑝0conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠1superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡:subscript𝑑11𝑑\displaystyle=\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{% \sigma}(t)}}{p_{0}(x_{s}^{1}|{\bm{x}}_{t}^{d_{1}+1:d})}.= divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 : italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

Here, we used the binomial expansion identity:

∑k=0d1−1Cd1−1k⁢[e−σ¯⁢(s)−e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(s)]k=[1+e−σ¯⁢(s)−e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(s)]d1−1.superscriptsubscript𝑘0subscript𝑑11superscriptsubscript𝐶subscript𝑑11𝑘superscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠𝑘superscriptdelimited-[]1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠subscript𝑑11\sum_{k=0}^{d_{1}-1}C_{d_{1}-1}^{k}\left[\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}-e^{-\bar{% \sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}}\right]^{k}=\left[1+\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}% (s)}-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}}\right]^{d_{1}-1}.∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ 1 + divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

Similarly, for xs1=[M]superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠1delimited-[]Mx_{s}^{1}=[\textbf{M}]italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ]:

ps|t1⁢([M]|𝒙t)=1−e−σ¯⁢(s)1−e−σ¯⁢(t).superscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡1conditionaldelimited-[]Msubscript𝒙𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡p_{s|t}^{1}([\textbf{M}]|{\bm{x}}_{t})=\frac{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}}{1-e^{-% \bar{\sigma}(t)}}.italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( [ M ] | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = divide start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG . (D.7)

In general, we have

ps|ti⁢(xsi|𝒙t)={e−σ¯⁢(s)−e−σ¯⁢(t)1−e−σ¯⁢(t)⁢p0⁢(xsi|𝒙tUM),xsi≠[M],xti=[M],1−e−σ¯⁢(s)1−e−σ¯⁢(t),xsi=[M],xti=[M],δxsi⁢xti,xti≠[M].superscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡𝑖conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑖subscript𝒙𝑡casessuperscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡subscript𝑝0conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑡UMformulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑖delimited-[]Msuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]M1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑠1superscript𝑒¯𝜎𝑡formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑖delimited-[]Msuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]Msubscript𝛿superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑖delimited-[]Mp_{s|t}^{i}(x_{s}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_{t})=\begin{cases}\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}-e^% {-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{p_{0}(x_{s}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_{t}^{% \textrm{UM}})},&x_{s}^{i}\neq[\textbf{M}],x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}],\\ \frac{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(s)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}},&x_{s}^{i}=[\textbf{M}],% x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}],\\ \delta_{x_{s}^{i}x_{t}^{i}},&x_{t}^{i}\neq[\textbf{M}].\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - D.3 Euler method and its simplified form in RADD

According to theory of CTMC [35, 26, 29], given a particular one-dimensional input xtsubscript𝑥𝑡x_{t}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the transition probabilities to xssubscript𝑥𝑠x_{s}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT can be approximately calculated using Eq. 2.1 and Eq. 2.12 as follows:

ps|t⁢(xs|xt)subscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡conditionalsubscript𝑥𝑠subscript𝑥𝑡\displaystyle p_{s|t}(x_{s}|x_{t})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =δxt⁢xs+𝑸~t⁢(xt,xs)⁢(t−s)+o⁢(t−s),absentsubscript𝛿subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠subscript~𝑸𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠𝑡𝑠𝑜𝑡𝑠\displaystyle=\delta_{x_{t}x_{s}}+\tilde{{\bm{Q}}}_{t}(x_{t},x_{s})(t-s)+o(t-s),= italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_t - italic_s ) + italic_o ( italic_t - italic_s ) , (D.9)
≈δxt⁢xs+𝑸~t⁢(xt,xs)⁢(t−s),absentsubscript𝛿subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠subscript~𝑸𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠𝑡𝑠\displaystyle\approx\delta_{x_{t}x_{s}}+\tilde{{\bm{Q}}}_{t}(x_{t},x_{s})(t-s),≈ italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_t - italic_s ) , (D.10)

where

𝑸~t⁢(xt,xs)subscript~𝑸𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠\displaystyle\tilde{{\bm{Q}}}_{t}(x_{t},x_{s})over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ={𝑸t⁢(xs,xt)⁢pt⁢(xs)pt⁢(xt),xt≠xs,−∑k≠xt𝑸~t⁢(xt,k),xt=xs.absentcasessubscript𝑸𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑝𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠subscript𝑝𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠subscript𝑘subscript𝑥𝑡subscript~𝑸𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝑘subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠\displaystyle=\begin{cases}{\bm{Q}}_{t}(x_{s},x_{t})\frac{p_{t}(x_{s})}{p_{t}(% x_{t})},&x_{t}\neq x_{s},\\ -\sum_{k\neq x_{t}}\tilde{{\bm{Q}}}_{t}(x_{t},k),&x_{t}=x_{s}.\end{cases}= { start_ROW start_CELL bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k ≠ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_k ) , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (D.11)

Therefore, we can define the Euler approximation of the transition probability [26, 29]:

ps|teuler⁢(xs|xt)=δxt⁢xs+𝑸~t⁢(xt,xs)⁢(t−s)superscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡eulerconditionalsubscript𝑥𝑠subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝛿subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠subscript~𝑸𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠𝑡𝑠p_{s|t}^{\text{euler}}(x_{s}|x_{t})=\delta_{x_{t}x_{s}}+\tilde{{\bm{Q}}}_{t}(x% _{t},x_{s})(t-s)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT euler end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_t - italic_s ) (D.12)

For multi-dimensional case, we factorize ps|teuler⁢(𝒙s|𝒙t)superscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡eulerconditionalsubscript𝒙𝑠subscript𝒙𝑡p_{s|t}^{\text{euler}}({\bm{x}}_{s}|{\bm{x}}_{t})italic_p ), where ps|teuler,i⁢(xsi|𝒙t)superscriptsubscript𝑝conditional𝑠𝑡euler𝑖conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑖subscript𝒙𝑡p_{s|t}^{\text{euler},i}(x_{s}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_{t})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s xtsubscript𝑥𝑡x_{t}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and xt1⁢⋯⁢xsi⁢⋯⁢xtdsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡1⋯superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑠𝑖⋯superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝑑x_{t}^{1}\cdots x_{s}^{i}\cdots
